Tshivenḓa: “Oh, hai!”
“Lulu! Ndi tshifhinga tsha uṱuwa,” Mma vha vhidzelela.
Lulu u ngafhi? U fhasi ha sofa? U nga murahu ha xaraḓeni?
Lulu u ngafhi? U tsini na tshiṱofu? U khabodoni?
“Lulu! Ndi tshifhinga tsha u ṱuwa. Ni ngafhi?” Mma vha vhidzelela.
“Khezwi no swika!”“A thi ṱoḓi u ṱuwaa!”
“Ri khou fanela u ṱuwa,”Mma vha ralo.“Fhedzi ndi khou funesaheyi ngoho!”
“Ngoho ndi funesa heyi!”
“Na heyi.”
“Na heyi.”“Na heyi.”
“Ni khou zwi vhona? Ni humisa dzibugu na hadzima dziṅwe.”“YAY!”
Lulu u ngafhi zwino?
English: “Oh, no!”
“Lulu! It’s time to go,” calls Ma.
Where is Lulu?Is she under the sofa?Is she behind the curtain?
Where is Lulu?Is she next to the stove?Is she in the cupboard?
“Lulu! It’s time to go. Where are you?” calls Ma.
“There you are!”“I don’t want to gooo!”
“We have to go,” says Ma.“But I really like this one!”
“I really like this one!”
“And this one.”
“And this one.”“And this one.”
“See? You return books and borrow more.”“YAY!”
Where is Lulu now?

Tshivenḓa: Mbevha yo vha i tshi khou ṱoḓa nnḓu ntswa.
Heyi i vhonala sa nnḓu yavhuḓi.
“Ni nga ḓa na eḓela na nṋe,” hu amba Mbwanana.“Ndo livhuwa,” hu amba Mbevha.
Vhusiku uvho, miloro ya Mbevha yo vha i tshi tou vha fhano na vhaḽa i sa tou vha khagala.
“Ni nga ḓa na eḓela na nṋe.” hu amba Pharotho.“Ndo livhuwa,” hu amba Mbevha
Vhusiku uvho, miloro ya Mbevha yo vha i na phosho i sa langei.
“Ni nga ḓa na eḓela na nṋe,” Hu amba Khovhe.“Ndo livhuwa,” hu amba Mbevha.
Vhusiku uvho, miloro ya Mbevha yo vha yo ḓala murotho na u ṋukala.
Mbevha yo vha i tshi khou ṱoḓa fhethu hu dudelaho nahone ho omaho.
Mbevha ya wana raka ya bugu.
Vhusiku uvho, Mbevha yo lora miloro yavhuḓi.
Vhusiku havhuḓi Mbevha.
English: Mouse was looking for a new house.
This looks like a nice house.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Puppy. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were bouncy and muddy.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Parrot. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were noisy and wild.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Fish. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were cold and wet.
Mouse needed somewhere warm and dry.
Mouse found a bookshelf nearby.
That night, Mouse had warm and cosy dreams.
Good night, Mouse.

Tshivenḓa: Baba!
A songo ofha.
Huhuu i ya nnḓa!
Kha vha sedze, Mmbwa i khou ḓisa bola.
Bola?
Mmbwa i khou ṱoḓa u tamba.U tamba?
Kha vha gavhe bola.
Huhuu i ya nnḓa!
Sedzani, Baba vha khou tamba.
Hu tamba inwi zwino.
Gavhani, Huhuu!
English: Daddy!
Don’t be scared.
Woof-woof out!
Look, Doggy’s bringing the ball.
Ball?
Doggy wants to play. Play?
Catch the ball.
Woof-woof out!
Look, Daddy’s playing.
Now you play.
Catch, Woof-woof!
